creator: dacostamartins@agere.com
text:
Currently, I a reporting an issue that I have in Win32 systems, when attempting 
to generate korean language output files.
When I try to add gulim.ttc: I get the following error:
(...)
Reading C:\WINNT/fonts\gulim.tcc...
This is a TrueType collection file with4 fonts
Containing the following fonts:
 G u l i m
 G u l i m C h e
 D o t u m 
 D o t u m C h e
java.io.IOException: failed to read font
        at org.apache.fop.fonts.TTFFile.readFont(TTFFile.java:415)
        at org.apache.fop.fonts.apps.TTFReader.loadTTF(TTFReader.java:222)
        at org.apache.fop.fonts.apps.TTFReader.main(TTFReader.java:184)

All other *.ttc (for Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese or Japanese 
language) work... and I am using the same methods...

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text:
I'm tracking it down. TTFFile currently only handles names as ISO-8859-1 
strings, but as can be seen in the error report, names can also be UnicodeBig.
Fixed in both HEAD and maintenance branch CVS.
creator: jeremias@apache.org

text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
creator: gadams@apache.org
